pr_title: Gracefully crash if there is no password stored

timeline.bodyText:
I guess this is caused by .charAt(0)?
If yes, instead of catching the exception, my suggestion would be to use StringUtils#startsWith instead which will gracefully handle this in the first place and also handle null.
timeline.author: lkiesow

replies.bodyText: Seems my guess was correct. The cause is charAt and switching to startsWith should fix the underlying problem.
replies.author: lkiesow

replies.bodyText: Yep, my concern exactly.  I haven't had a chance to dig deeper into this, but this logic appears to check if there is an old md5'd password, and failing that checks for a bcrypt'd one.  If neither of these things are true, shouldn't this throw an exception?  A user without a valid form of password seems like a bug to me.
replies.author: gregorydlogan

replies.bodyText: No. You really don't want to throw an exception here if possible since this will cause Opencast to return an internal server error on login and may even disclose internal log-in credentials which is why I would also be careful with logging here. That's also part of why the logging for the IllegalArgumentException is just debug.
replies.author: lkiesow

timeline.message: Modified with a "StartsWith" instead of an exception

timeline.bodyText: This will indeed handle more cases but will still fail if encodedPassword is null. Can we switch to using StringUtils#startsWith? That will handle that as well.
timeline.author: lkiesow

replies.bodyText: I don't understand you, I changed yesterday to use startsWith
replies.author: mliradelc
lkiesow

replies.bodyText: Aha!, I thought that it was StringUtils, I will change that ASAP!
replies.author: mliradelc
